body: What version of aura/intl do you have? I don't get the same error with aura/intl 1.1.1. Are you customizing the fallback loader at all?

Version 1.1.1, installed via composer. Did not customize the fallback loader. But I think it's a bug in their code as well, since `$this->fallback` should adhere to `TranslatorInterface` which does not specify `getMessage` only `translate`.
I had the same bug only in production. Somehow it solved by nuking vendor directory and reinstalling via `composer install`
@raul338 tried your suggestion, but did not solve the problem for me. If I have time this weekend I'll check if I can create a small project that reproduces the problem consistently.
@JoepRoebroek I double checked that the tests do hit the fallback loader (they do). I'm not sure why we don't see the protected method errors in our own test harness.
Could you try clearing out the translation cache, and possibly deleting and reinstalling aura/intl?

@markstory Thanks, today, on my dev environment, I flushed my Redis cache and then the problem disappears. So it's a caching issue. From here, I need to check how I can reproduce the error once again.

Ok, so the following goes wrong:
- There is `PackageLocator` in Aura with a cached registry
- There is `TranslatorLocator` in Aura with a cached registry
- There is `TranslatorFactory` in Aura which is extended and modified in CakePHP such that the translators are factored with the `Cake\I18n\Translator` class.

If the PackageLocator can retrieve its translator from cache, but TranslatorLocator cannot, the error occurs. Since the fallback comes from PackageLocator and in cache this is Aura, and the main instance comes from TranslatorLocator and this is the Cake Translator.

Personally, I think adjusting the public interface of the TranslatorInterface is the best way to go. But I can imagine that checking if the instance classnames match and throwing a descriptive exception is also a good way to go as a quick fix. From the exception people could learn they should try and clear their `_cake_core_` cache.

>  I also advocate that the TranslatorInterface in Aura should be adjusted, such that there is a public interface in which the translator instances can fallback on each other.

You are welcome to take that up with the Aura folks. :smile:

> But I can imagine that checking if the instance classnames match and throwing a descriptive exception is also a good way to go as a quick fix. From the exception people could learn they should try and clear their _cake_core_ cache.

Would you be willing to put together a pull request with this new warning/error?

> Would you be willing to put together a pull request with this new warning/error? 

:+1: no problem, I'll have time to do this tomorrow
